title: Capella unveils automated tasking products
summary: Capella Space unveiled three products April 14 that automate tasking of the company’s constellation of synthetic aperture radar (SAR) satellites.

title: NASA into next attempt to complete modified Artemis 1 Wet Dress Rehearsal
summary: NASA is trying again at a third attempt on April 14 to complete the Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) test on its Artemis 1 vehicle. The integrated Orion spacecraft and Space Launch System (SLS) rocket for Artemis 1 will be launched by the agency’s Exploration Ground Systems (EGS) program from the Kennedy Space Center (KSC) in Florida on a mission to the Moon.

title: China gears up for new space station missions, record-breaking crew set to return home
summary: A Long March rocket arrived at Wenchang spaceport Monday in preparation for a new round of space station missions starting May.

title: NASA shifts Earth science mission to previously flown Falcon 9
summary: NASA’s embrace of reused rockets continued with an agreement this month to switch the upcoming launch of an Earth science satellite from a new to a previously flown Falcon 9, a change whose full terms remain proprietary.

title: SpaceX, NASA refine Crew-4 launch date as Axiom astronauts focus on science
summary: SpaceX and NASA have delayed Crew Dragon’s fourth operational Commercial Crew launch for the fifth time as four private Axiom Space astronauts...

title: Russian invasion of Ukraine exposes cybersecurity threat to commercial satellites
summary: Cybersecurity experts have been warning for years of increasing attacks on commercial satellites and working with companies to enhance security.

title: ESA ends cooperation with Russia on lunar missions
summary: ESA announced April 13 it was further cutting ties with Russia by dropping plans to cooperate on a series of lunar missions, turning instead to NASA and other agencies.

title: Dirk Hoke to lead propulsion startup Plasmos
summary: Dirk Hoke, the former CEO of Airbus Defence and Space, is joining propulsion startup Plasmos Inc. as chairman of the board.

title: Intelligence official says U.S. government is not micromanaging commercial imagery
summary: Many of the commercial companies that are openly sharing satellite imagery of Ukraine work with the U.S. government but are not restricted in what they can share, said Stacey Dixon, principal deputy director of national intelligence

title: NASA Sets Coverage for Russian Spacewalks Outside Space Station
summary: NASA will provide coverage of spacewalks Monday, April 18, and Thursday, April 28, as  Russian cosmonauts venture outside the International Space Station to activate a new robotic arm attached to the Nauka module.
